doc_title: A Formative Team Experience: Leading Capella's Annual Production
body:
Co-managing Capella's annual dance production was an experience that deeply shaped my understanding of leadership, collaboration, and the delicate balance between performance and operational execution. As both a performing member and the logistics lead, I found myself navigating a multifaceted role within a constrained budget and timeline, which added layers of complexity to the process.

The context of this annual production was both exhilarating and demanding. Every year, we aimed to present a cohesive and artistic performance that resonated with our audience while ensuring that all logistical aspects ran smoothly. My dual role meant I was not only performing as a dancer but also responsible for attendance tracking, logistics planning, infrastructure coordination, and mentoring junior members. This blend of responsibilities required a structured approach to manage time and resources effectively.

Throughout the production cycle, I encountered specific challenges that tested our team's resilience and adaptability. One notable challenge was dealing with injury substitutions. During rehearsals, a key dancer sustained an injury, necessitating a rapid reassignment of roles. This situation required me to remain calm under pressure, quickly evaluating our talent pool and reallocating responsibilities while ensuring that the quality of the performance would not be compromised.

Another significant hurdle arose from exam schedule clashes among our performers. With many of us balancing academic commitments alongside our passion for dance, I had to facilitate discussions that respected both our educational priorities and the integrity of our production. This often meant negotiating rehearsal times and being flexible in accommodating everyone’s needs, guiding our team through the complexities of academic and artistic commitments.

Costume delays also posed a challenge. As the logistical lead, I had to coordinate with vendors and ensure that all costumes were ready ahead of time. This involved continuous follow-ups and, at times, making on-the-spot decisions about alternatives if the original designs were not delivered on schedule.

One of the hardest decisions I had to make during the 2021-22 production was cutting the budget for our choreographer. Given the uncertainty of competition outcomes, I had to weigh the consequences of this decision carefully. Reducing the choreographer's fees could potentially impact the quality of the choreography, but the tradeoff was essential to ensure that we could allocate resources to other critical areas, such as costume procurement and venue logistics. Ultimately, I decided that maintaining the production's overall integrity was more crucial than investing heavily in choreography that might not yield the desired competitive advantage.

Through this experience, I learned invaluable lessons about collaboration. Multi-role context switching became second nature as I toggled between being a dancer and a logistics coordinator. I designed a team structure that clearly delineated responsibilities between performers and operational roles, which improved accountability and communication among team members. Navigating roadblocks required a proactive mindset and clear communication, ensuring everyone was aligned with our objectives.

On a personal level, I discovered a strong sense of ownership and commitment to the project. The need for constrained project execution forced me to refine my ability to balance performance quality with operational needs. I learned the art of leading while also actively participating, recognizing that clear communication was paramount in rallying our team around shared goals.

Ultimately, my experience co-managing Capella's annual production taught me about the delicate balance of leading and performing, making tough tradeoffs, and the importance of fostering a collaborative environment. Each challenge reinforced the belief that effective leadership is not solely about delegating tasks but also about being present and engaged in all aspects of the endeavor.
